revision.text:
This article presents lists of the literary events and publications in '''1521'''.{{Year nav topic5|1521|literature}}
==Events== *June 29 or 30 – [[Neacșu's letter]]: oldest surviving dateable document written primarily in the [[Romanian language]] (in the [[Romanian Cyrillic alphabet]]). *August 13 – [[Marko Marulić]]'s poem ''[[Judita]]'' ("Judith", written 1501), a landmark in [[Croatian literature]], is printed in Venice by Guglielmo da Fontaneto. [[Image:Judita-str1.gif|200px|thumb|[[Marko Marulić]]'s ''[[Judita]]'']] *[[John Siberch]] is active as a printer in [[Cambridge]], England, the earliest known there.
==New books== ===Prose=== *''Codex Ňuu Tnoo - Ndisi Nuu'' *[[Jacopo Berengario da Carpi]] – ''Commentaria cum amplissimus additionibus super anatomiam Mundini'' (published in [[Bologna]]), containing the first printed anatomical illustrations taken from nature *[[Goražde Psalter]] *[[Henry VIII of England]] – ''[[Defence of the Seven Sacraments]]'' (''Assertio Septem Sacramentorum'') *[[Niccolò Machiavelli]] – ''[[The Art of War (Machiavelli)|The Art of War]]'' (''Dell'arte della guerra'') *[[Piri Reis]] – ''Kitab-ı Bahriye''
===Poetry=== {{main|1521 in poetry}} *[[Alexander Barclay]] – ''The Boke of Codrus and Mynalcas'', the author's "Fourth Eclog"<ref name=cocel>{{cite book|editor=Cox, Michael|title=The Concise Oxford Chronology of English Literature|publisher=Oxford University Press|year=2004|isbn=0-19-860634-6}}</ref> *[[Henry Bradshaw (poet)|Henry Bradshaw]] – ''The Life of St. Werburgh''<ref name=cocel/> *[[Andrew Chertsey]], ''The Passyon of Oure Lorde'', translated from French with additional verses inserted and introductory poem by [[Robert Copland]] (published in London by [[Wynkyn de Worde]])<ref name=cocel/> *''Christmas Carols'', including "A caroll of huntynge" and "A carol bringyng in the bores heed"<ref name=cocel/> *[[Robert Copland]] – Introductory verse to ''The Myrrour & the Chyrche'' (published in London by Wynkyn de Worde)<ref name="chedpd">{{cite web|url=http://www-sul.stanford.edu/depts/hasrg/ats/engpo5-toc.html |work=Academic Text Service (ATS) |title=Chadwyck-Healey English Poetry Database – Tudor Poetry, 1500-1603 |publisher=Stanford University Library |accessdate=2009-09-08 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5jhECwytY?url=http://www-sul.stanford.edu/depts/hasrg/ats/engpo5-toc.html |archivedate=2009-09-11 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> *''Approximate dates'' **{{sic|hide=y|''A boke of a Ghoostly fader''}} (A Book of a Ghostly Father, published in London by Wynkyn de Worde)<ref name=cocel/><ref name=chedpd/> **[[John Skelton]], "The Tunnyng of Elynour Rummyng"<ref name=cocel/><ref>Reprinted in Skelton's ''Certain Books'' (1545).</ref>
==Births== ''Unknown dates'' **Sir [[Thomas Chaloner (statesman)|Thomas Chaloner]] the elder, English statesman and poet (died [[1565 in literature|1565]]) **[[Xu Wei]] (徐渭), Chinese painter, poet and dramatist (died [[1593 in literature|1593]]) *''Approximate years'' **[[Anne Askew]], English poet and Protestant martyr (burned at the stake [[1546 in literature|1546]]) **[[Jorge de Montemor]], Portuguese novelist and poet writing in Spanish (died [[1561 in literature|1561]]) **[[Pontus de Tyard]], French poet and priest, a member of ''[[La Pléiade]]'' (died [[1605 in literature|1605]])
==Deaths== *[[May 10]] – [[Sebastian Brant]], German satirical poet and humanist (born c. 1457)
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:1521 In Literature}} [[Category:1521]] [[Category:1521 books]] [[Category:Years in literature]] [[Category:Years of the 16th century in literature]]

revision.text:
{{Year nav topic5|2017|film|home video|television}} {{Yearsinfilm}}
'''2017 in film''' is an overview of events, including the highest-grossing films, award ceremonies, festivals, and a list of films released and notable deaths.
==Evaluation of the year== [[Richard Brody]] of ''[[The New Yorker]]'' observed that for 2017, "the most important event in the world of movies was the revelation, in the ''[[The New York Times|Times]]'' and ''The New Yorker'', of [[Harvey Weinstein sexual abuse allegations|sexual abuse]] by [[Harvey Weinstein]], and the [[Weinstein effect|resulting liberation of the long-stifled voices of the people who had been abused by him or other powerful figures]] in the movie business, and, for that matter, in other arts and industries, too." He emphasizes that in effect, "[w]hat's missing from the year-end list, and from the era in movies, isn't only the unmade work by these filmmakers but the artistry and the careers of cast and crew members who would have been in their unrealized films."<ref>{{cite web|last1=Brody|first1=Richard|authorlink1=Richard Brody|title=The Best Movies of 2017|url=https://www.newyorker.com/culture/2017-in-review/the-best-movies-of-2017|website=[[The New Yorker]]|publisher=[[Condé Nast]]|accessdate=7 January 2018|date=8 December 2017}}</ref>
==Highest-grossing films== {{see also|Lists of box office number-one films#2017}} The top films released in 2017 by worldwide gross are as follows:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/yearly/chart/?view2=worldwide&yr=2017&p=.htm|title=2017 Yearly Box Office Results|website=[[Box Office Mojo]]|publisher=[[IMDb|IMDb.com, Inc.]]|accessdate=7 April 2018}}</ref> <!-- Note: We only link the distributor ONCE --> {| class="wikitable" style="margin:auto; margin:auto;" |+Highest-grossing films of 2017 |- ! Rank!! Title !! Distributor !! Worldwide gross |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 1 |''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi]]'' | rowspan="2" |[[Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures|Disney]] | $1,332,539,889 |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 2 | ''[[Beauty and the Beast (2017 film)|Beauty and the Beast]]'' | $1,263,521,126 |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 3 | ''[[The Fate of the Furious ]]'' | rowspan="2"|[[Universal Pictures|Universal]] | $1,236,005,118 |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 4 | ''[[Despicable Me 3]]'' | $1,034,799,409 |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 5 | ''[[Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle]]'' | rowspan="2" | [[Sony Pictures]] | $962,077,546 |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 6 | ''[[Spider-Man: Homecoming]]'' | $880,166,924 |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 7 | ''[[Wolf Warrior 2]]'' | United Entertainment | $874,325,959<ref>http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=wolfwarrior2.htm</ref> |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 8 | ''[[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2]]'' | rowspan="2" | Disney | $863,756,051 |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 9 | ''[[Thor: Ragnarok]]'' | $853,977,126 |- ! style="text-align:center;"| 10 | ''[[Wonder Woman (2017 film)|Wonder Woman]]'' | [[Warner Bros.]] | $821,847,012 |} ''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi]]'', ''[[Beauty and the Beast (2017 film)|Beauty and the Beast]]'', ''[[The Fate of the Furious]]'', and ''[[Despicable Me 3]]'' have each grossed over $1 billion, and are ranked as the [[List of highest-grossing films|11th, 13th, 14th, and 27th highest-grossing films of all time]], with the latter being the [[List of highest-grossing animated films|4th highest-grossing animated film]]. ''[[Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle]]'' is ranked as the [[List of highest-grossing films|40th highest-grossing film of all time]].
''[[Wolf Warrior 2]]'', a [[Chinese film]], became the first non-Hollywood film to be listed on the all-time worldwide top 100 box office.<ref name="mint">{{cite news|last=Minter|first=Adam|title=China's new blockbuster 'Wolf Warrior 2' should worry Hollywood|url=http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/siNn7wVU6qFvjWC8zNXS0H/Chinas-new-blockbuster-Wolf-Warrior-2-should-worry-Hollyw.html|work=[[Live Mint]]|date=23 August 2017}}</ref>
''[[Split (2016 American film)|Split]]'', by [[M. Night Shyamalan]], was the year's most profitable film in terms of [[return on investment]] (ROI), having generated over 2,000% ROI. It is the 11th film to cross 2,000% ROI, and the first film to do so since 2015.<ref>{{cite web |title=Movie Budgets, Most Expensive Movies, Most Profitable Movies, Biggest Money-Losing Movies |url=https://www.the-numbers.com/movie/budgets |website=[[The Numbers (website)|The Numbers]] |accessdate=July 27, 2018}}</ref>
===2017 box office records=== *In [[China]], the country recorded a new single-day record as well as an all-time admission high on Saturday, January 28, with over [[Renminbi|¥]]755 million ($110 million) registering an admission of over 21 million moviegoers, beating the previous record of ¥647 million ($98.4 million) and 17 million admissions set the previous year. Both records were set on the first day of the [[Chinese New Year]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chinafilminsider.com/journey-west-demons-strike-back-sets-records/|title='Journey to the West: The Demons Strike Back' Sets Records|author=Jonathan Papish|work=China Film Insider|date=29 January 2017|accessdate=30 January 2017}}</ref> *In May, China had its first consecutive monthly gain in box office revenue in more than a year, led by Indian film ''[[Dangal (film)|Dangal]]'', followed by Hollywood film ''[[Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales]]''.<ref name="bloomberg">{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-06-01/-dangal-disney-s-pirates-lead-china-box-office-gains-in-may|title='Dangal,' Disney's 'Pirates' Lead China Box-Office Gains in May|date=1 June 2017|publisher=|via=www.bloomberg.com}}</ref> *2017 has been a record year for non-Hollywood foreign films in the Chinese market, with the success of films such as India's ''Dangal'', Thailand's ''[[Bad Genius]]'' and Spain's ''[[Contratiempo]]''. {{as of|2017|November|5|df=US}}, non-Hollywood imports account for 72% ($519.7 million) of the year's foreign film box office revenue so far ($723 million), with ''Dangal'' alone accounting for 27% ($195.8 million).<ref name="variety">{{cite news|last=Chow|first=Vivienne|title=Chinese Audiences Move Away From Hollywood Pictures|url=https://variety.com/2017/biz/markets-festivals/bad-genius-chinese-audiences-move-away-from-hollywood-films-1202606930/|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=November 5, 2017}}</ref> *The [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] became the [[List of highest-grossing films#Highest-grossing franchises and film series|first film franchise]] to gross more than $11 billion with the release of ''[[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://heroichollywood.com/marvel-universe-11-billion-worldwide/|title=Marvel Cinematic Universe Breaks $11 Billion Worldwide|date=1 May 2017|publisher=}}</ref> With the subsequent release of ''[[Spider-Man: Homecoming]]'', it became the first film franchise to gross more than $12 billion,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://screenrant.com/marvel-cinematic-universe-12-billion-box-office-worldwide/|title=MCU Passes $12 Billion Worldwide|date=9 July 2017|publisher=}}</ref> and with the release of ''[[Thor: Ragnarok]]'', the MCU became the first film franchise to gross more than $13 billion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/movies/franchise/Marvel-Cinematic-Universe#tab=summary|title=Marvel Cinematic Universe Franchise Box Office History - The Numbers|website=www.the-numbers.com}}</ref> It also became the first film franchise to release three movies in one year that all made over $800 million worldwide and opened to over $100 million domestically (through the aforementioned entries). *The ''[[Despicable Me (franchise)|Despicable Me]]'' franchise became [[List of highest-grossing animated films#Highest-grossing animated franchises and film series|the highest-grossing animated franchise]] ever ($3.6 billion), surpassing the ''[[Shrek (franchise)|Shrek]]'' franchise; it also became the first animation franchise to have two films hit over $1 billion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/08/despicable-me-highest-grossing-animated-franchise-all-time-shrek-illumination-universal-box-office-1202143599/|title='Despicable Me' Becomes Top-Grossing Animated Film Franchise Ever Worldwide|first=Nancy|last=Tartaglione|date=6 August 2017|publisher=}}</ref> *With ''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi]]'', ''[[Beauty and the Beast (2017 film)|Beauty and the Beast]]'', and ''[[Wonder Woman (2017 film)|Wonder Woman]]'', 2017 was the first year since [[1958 in film|1958]] (''[[South Pacific (1958 film)|South Pacific]]'', ''[[Auntie Mame (film)|Auntie Mame]]'', ''[[Cat on a Hot Tin Roof (1958 film)|Cat on a Hot Tin Roof]]'') in which the top 3 highest grossing domestic films were female led.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elle.com/culture/movies-tv/a14526029/female-led-films-won-box-office-2017/|title=Female-Led Films Won at the Box Office in 2017 for the First Time in 59 Years|first=Kaleigh|last=Roberts|date=1 January 2018|publisher=}}</ref> *''Wolf Warrior 2'' was a massive commercial success and became the highest-grossing Chinese film ever released. The film broke numerous box office records, including the biggest single-day gross for a Chinese film as well as the fastest film to cross the RMB 2 billion, 3 billion, 4 billion and 5 billion box office marks. It also became the fastest film to surpass US$500 million and the first film to gross more than US$600 million at the [[List of highest-grossing films in China|Chinese box office]]. At a total domestic gross of {{CNY|5.68 billion}} (USD$874 million),<ref name="qz.com">{{cite news|last1=Huang|first1=Zheping|title=China's top 10 box office hits of all time include four domestic films released in 2017|url=https://qz.com/1169192/chinas-all-time-top-10-box-office-list-has-four-domestic-films-released-in-2017-including-wolf-warrior-2/|work=Quartz}}</ref><ref name="内地总票房_电影历史票房_中国票房">{{cite web|title=内地总票房_电影历史票房_中国票房|url=http://www.cbooo.cn/Alltimedomestic|website=www.cbooo.cn}}</ref> it is the second highest-grossing film of all-time in a single market behind only ''[[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]]'' ($936.7 million in North America), and having exceeded North America's totals from ''[[Avatar (2009 film)|Avatar]]'' ($760 million), ''[[Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]]'' ($659 million) and ''[[Jurassic World]]'' ($652 million).<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tartaglione|first1=Nancy|title='Wolf' Whistles To $685M; 'Annabelle' Conjures $35M+; 'Spider-Man' Leaps Past $700M WW – International Box Office|url=http://deadline.com/2017/08/wolf-warrior-2-annabelle-creation-dunkirk-spider-man-homecoming-weekend-results-international-box-office-1202147805/|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=16 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/alltime/domestic.htm|title=All Time Domestic Box Office Results|website=www.boxofficemojo.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/china-box-office-wolf-warrior-2-wins-third-weekend-marches-700m-1029113|title=China Box Office: 'Wolf Warrior 2' Wins Third Weekend, Marches Towards $700M|publisher=}}</ref> The film was the [[2017 in film#Highest grossing films|sixth highest-grossing film of 2017]] at US$874 million, making it the 54th highest-grossing film worldwide.<ref name="qz.com"/><ref>http://www.boxofficemojo.com/alltime/world/</ref><ref name="内地总票房_电影历史票房_中国票房"/> It is the first and only Chinese film ever to be included in the list of 100 all-time highest-grossing films worldwide.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2017/08/14/box-office-wolf-warrior-2-cracks-100-all-time-biggest-grossers-list/#7f1530bd43a4|title=Box Office: 'Wolf Warrior 2' Cracks 100 All-Time Biggest Grossers List|first=Scott|last=Mendelson|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/alltime/world/|title=All Time Worldwide Box Office Grosses|website=www.boxofficemojo.com}}</ref> It was selected as the Chinese entry for the [[Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[90th Academy Awards]].<ref name="THR">{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/oscars-92-films-submitted-foreign-language-film-academy-award-1046070 |title=Oscars: 92 Films Submitted in Foreign-Language Category |last=Kilday |first=Gregg |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=5 October 2017 |accessdate=5 October 2017}}</ref>
====Studio records==== *[[Walt Disney Studios (division)|Walt Disney Studios]] became the first studio ever to reach $6 billion at the global box office in consecutive years (following a $7.6-billion gross in [[2016 in film|2016]]), and the first studio to reach $5 billion globally in three consecutive years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://comicbook.com/starwars/2017/12/26/disney-6-billion-twice-global-box-office-marvel-star-wars/|title=Disney is Now The Only Studio to Hit $6 Billion Twice at Worldwide Box Office|last=Bonomolo|first=Cameron|publisher=ComicBook.com|date=December 25, 2017|accessdate=December 26, 2017}}</ref>
====Film records==== *In [[China]], the film ''[[Wolf Warrior 2]]'' became the fastest film to reach 2 and 3 billion [[Renminbi|yuan]], as well as the first to reach 4 and 5 billion [[Renminbi|yuan]]. It is [[List of highest-grossing films in China|China's highest-grossing film]], as well as the highest-grossing non-Hollywood film.<ref name="mint"/> *''[[Dangal (film)|Dangal]]'' became the [[List of highest-grossing Indian films|highest-grossing Indian film]],<ref name="forbes">{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/robcain/2017/05/31/dangal-pins-down-1000-crore-rs-154-mm-to-become-chinas-leggiest-movie-ever/|title='Dangal' Pins Down 1,000 Crore Rs / $154 mm To Become China's Leggiest Movie Ever|first=Rob|last=Cain|publisher=}}</ref> crossing {{INRConvert|20|b}} worldwide,<ref name="dangal2000cr307mn">{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/robcain/2017/06/26/indias-dangal-takes-down-%E2%82%B92000-crore-305m-a-major-milestone-in-world-cinema/#4c75f0aa6723|title=India's 'Dangal' Blasts Past 2,000 Crore Rupees / $307M, A Milestone In World Cinema}}</ref> making it the first [[Indian film]] to gross $300 million worldwide.<ref>[http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/dangal-is-now-30th-biggest-hit-worldwide-but-this-is-all-aamir-khan-will-earn-from-it-4699729/ Dangal is now 30th biggest hit worldwide but this is all Aamir Khan will earn from it], ''[[Indian Express]]'', 12 June 2017</ref> ''Dangal'' is also the highest-grossing [[sports film]].<ref>[http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/dangal-box-office-collection-aamir-khan-film-rs-2000-crore-club-4714883/ Dangal box office: Aamir Khan film is fourth biggest worldwide hit for Disney, to enter Rs 2000-cr club this weekend], ''[[Indian Express]]'', 22 June 2017</ref> Most of its gross ($194.71{{nbsp}}million) came from China, where it became the highest-grossing non-Hollywood foreign film, surpassing Japanese [[anime]] film ''[[Your Name]]''.<ref name="variety"/> ''Dangal'' also became the highest-grossing non-English foreign film in any single market (China), surpassing the gross of previous record holder ''[[Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon]]'' (2000) which grossed $128{{nbsp}}million in North America.<ref name="bloomberg18">{{cite news|last=Miller|first=Lee|title=Bollywood Hit Beats 'Star Wars' at China's Box Office|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-01-28/bollywood-beats-star-wars-at-china-s-box-office-with-hindi-hit|work=[[Bloomberg News]]|date=28 January 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Miller|first=Lee|title=China Picks Bollywood Over Hollywood|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-01-29/china-picks-bollywood-over-hollywood|work=[[Bloomberg News]]|date=29 January 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Miller|first=Lee|title=How Aamir Khan's Secret Superstar beat 'Star Wars' at China's Box Office|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/how-aamir-khan-s-secret-superstar-beat-star-wars-at-china-s-box-office-118012900051_1.html|work=[[Business Standard]]|date=29 January 2018}}</ref> * In [[India]], ''[[Baahubali 2: The Conclusion]]'' became the highest-grossing film with a gross collection of {{INR|14.169 billion}}(US${{To USD|14169|IND|year=2017|round=yes}} million) in the country.<ref name="bb2">{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/baahubali-2-bahubali-2-box-office-collection-ss-rajamoulis-film-mints-rs-1706-50-cr-140-days-742747|title=Baahubali 2 (Bahubali 2)office collection: SS Rajamouli's film mints Rs 1,706.50 cr in 140 day |date=20 September 2017|publisher=IBTimes}}</ref> The film broke a numerous domestic records,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/box-office-records-shattered-by-baahubali-2-the-conclusion/photostory/58527467.cms|title=Baahubali 2:The Conclusion's all box office collection records: Box-office records shattered by 'Padmaavat'|website=The Times of India}}</ref> and also became the second-highest-grossing Indian film of all time with an estimated gross of {{INR|17.97 bilion}}(US$275 million) only behind ''Dangal''. *''[[Resident Evil: The Final Chapter]]'' scored the biggest three-day (Friday to Sunday) opening in China with an estimated ¥636.9 million ($92.7 million) debut, according to official local sources. This toppled the previous record holders ''[[Transformers: Age of Extinction]]'' (¥632 million) and ''[[Captain America: Civil War]]'' (¥628 million).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chinafilminsider.com/china-box-office-evil-takes-up-residence/|title=China Box Office: Evil Takes Up Residence, Sets New Precedent|author=Jonathan Papish|publisher=''China Film Insider''|date=February 28, 2017|accessdate=March 4, 2017}}</ref> *''[[Beauty and the Beast (2017 film)|Beauty and the Beast]]'' broke ''[[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice]]''{{'}}s records ($166 million) for the weekend debut in March ($174.8 million) and for a spring release, ''[[Pitch Perfect 2]]''{{'}}s record ($69.2 million) for the highest weekend debut for a musical film and ''[[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2]]''{{'}}s record ($169.2 million) for the highest weekend debut for a live-action fantasy film. *''[[The Fate of the Furious]]'' broke ''[[Jurassic World]]''{{'}}s record ($316.6 million) of largest foreign weekend debut ($432.3 million) and ''[[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]]''{{'}}s record ($529 million) of largest worldwide weekend debut ($541 million).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=4284&p=.htm|title='Fate of the Furious' Debuts with Record International and Worldwide Opening Weekend – Box Office Mojo|website=www.boxofficemojo.com}}</ref> *''[[Wonder Woman (2017 film)|Wonder Woman]]'', directed by [[Patty Jenkins]], grossed $103.3 million in its opening weekend, breaking the record for a female-directed film previously held by ''[[Fifty Shades of Grey (film)|Fifty Shades of Grey]]'', directed by [[Sam Taylor-Johnson]] ($85.2 million on 13–15 February 2015); the film also became the highest-grossing [[World War I]] film, surpassing ''[[War Horse (film)|War Horse]]'' ($79.9 million on 25–28 December 2011). It also became the highest-grossing superhero origin film. Overall, it is the highest-grossing female-directed film, surpassing [[Phyllida Lloyd]]'s ''[[Mamma Mia! (film)|Mamma Mia!]]'' ($609.8 million). *''[[Despicable Me 3]]'' broke ''[[The Twilight Saga: Eclipse]]''{{'}}s 4,464 theater count with a theater count of 4,529 theaters in its first week. It would have seven more theaters in its second week, going to 4,536 theaters. *''[[Dunkirk (2017 film)|Dunkirk]]'' grossed $525.6 million, making it the highest-grossing World War II film of all time, surpassing ''[[Saving Private Ryan]]'' ($481.8 million). *''[[It (2017 film)|It]]'' broke ''[[Hotel Transylvania 2]]''{{'}}s record for largest September opening weekend ($48.5 million), and ''[[Gravity (2013 film)|Gravity]]''{{'}}s record for largest fall opening weekend ($55.8 million) when it opened to $123.4 million and, subsequently, went on to become the unadjusted highest-grossing horror film in history, surpassing ''[[The Sixth Sense]]'' ($672.8 million). It is currently the third-highest-grossing [[Motion Picture Association of America film rating system|R-rated]] film, after ''[[Deadpool (film)|Deadpool]]'' and ''[[The Matrix Reloaded]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/sep/29/stephen-king-it-the-exorcist-highest-grossing-horror-film-ever|title=Stephen King's It scares off The Exorcist to become highest-grossing horror ever|last=Mumford |first=Gwilym|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=September 29, 2017|accessdate=October 5, 2017}}</ref> *''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi]]'' grossed $104.7 million in its opening day, becoming only the second movie (along with ''[[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]]'') to gross more than $100 million in a single day, and making the ''[[Star Wars]]'' franchise the first film series to include two movies that recorded $100-million grossing days. On December 30, ''Last Jedi'' surpassed a billion dollars at the global box office, making ''[[Star Wars]]'' the first franchise to release three consecutive billion-dollar-grossing films and the first franchise to release billion-dollar-grossing films in three consecutive years (along with [[2015 in film|2015]]'s ''Force Awakens'' and [[2016 in film|2016]]'s ''[[Rogue One]]''). ''Last Jedi'' also became the fourth ''Star Wars'' film to gross more than $1 billion, tying the ''Star Wars'' franchise with the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] for most billion-dollar films within a single franchise. *2017 breaks 2016's record for films that crossed over $500 million, with nineteen: the ten films in the table above, as well as ''[[Coco (2017 film)|Coco]]'', ''[[Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales]]'', ''[[It (2017 film)|It]]'', ''[[Justice League (film)|Justice League]]'', ''[[Logan (2017 film)|Logan]]'', ''[[Transformers: The Last Knight]]'', ''[[Kong: Skull Island]]'', ''[[The Boss Baby]]'', and ''[[Dunkirk (2017 film)|Dunkirk]]''. 2017 also broke 2016's record of films that crossed over $600 million with sixteen (''Coco'', ''Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales'', ''It'', ''Justice League'', ''Logan'', and ''Transformers: The Last Knight'' have all grossed over $600 million). It also surpasses 2016's record of films that earned over $700 million worldwide with thirteen consecutive films. (''Coco'', ''Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales'', and ''It'' have grossed over $700 million.) It additionally surpasses 2016's record of films that earned over $800 million worldwide with eleven, those being the ten in the table above and ''Coco'' (It also becomes the first year in history where every one of the top 10 highest-grossing films grossed over $800 million worldwide). And finally, it ties 2015 and 2016's record of films that earned over $900 million worldwide with five, those being the top five in the table above.

{{italic title}} [[File:Alciphron (1732) title page.jpg|thumb|''Alciphron'' title page (1732).]] '''''Alciphron''''', or '''''The Minute Philosopher''''' is an [[anticatholic]] philosophical [[dialogue]] by the 18th-century Irish philosopher [[George Berkeley]] wherein Berkeley combated the arguments of [[free-thinkers]] such as [[Bernard Mandeville|Mandeville]] and [[Anthony Ashley-Cooper, 3rd Earl of Shaftesbury|Shaftesbury]] against the [[Christianity|Christian]] [[religion]]. It was first published in 1732.
The dialogue is primarily between four characters, the free-thinkers Alciphron and Lysicles, Berkeley's spokesman Euphranor, and Crito, who serves as a spokesman for traditional Christianity. The mostly-silent narrator of the dialogue is given the name Dion.
The work contains two especially notable sections: * Dialogue IV, in which Berkeley presents a novel [[teleological argument]] for the existence of [[God]] based on Berkeley's theory of visual language, defended in the ''[[Essay Toward a New Theory of Vision]]'' (first published in 1709, and included with the first edition of ''Alciphron'').<ref>See David Kline, "Berkeley's Divine Language Argument" in Ernest Sosa, ed., ''Essays on the Philosophy of George Berkeley'' (Dordrecht: Reidel, 1987), repr. in David Berman, ed., ''Alciphron in Focus'' (London: Routledge, 1993).</ref> * Dialogue VII, in which Berkeley presents a novel theory of language which has been compared with the theory of language advocated by [[Ludwig Wittgenstein]] in his ''Philosophical Investigations''.<ref>Anthony Flew, "Was Berkeley a Precursor of Wittgenstein?" in W. B. Todd, ed. ''Hume and the Enlightenment: Essays Presented to Ernest Campbell Mossner'' (Edinburgh: The University Press, 1974), repr. in Berman, ed., ''Alciphron''.</ref> In a later work, ''[[The Theory of Vision Vindicated and Explained]]'' (first published in 1733), Berkeley adduced the work of [[Alberto Radicati]] as evidence that the views advocated by the character Lysicles were not overly exaggerated (para. 5).
== Notes == {{reflist}}

{{Infobox religious building | building_name=Ancona Cathedral
(Metropolitan Cathedral-Basilica of Saint Cyriacus)
{{lang|it|Basilica Cattedrale Metropolitana di San Ciriaco}} | image=Cattedrale di San Ciriaco (Ancona).JPG | caption= | location= [[Ancona]], [[Italy]] | geo = {{coord|43|37|31|N|13|30|37|E|type:landmark_region:IT|display=inline,title}} | religious_affiliation=[[Roman Catholic]] | rite= | province=[[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Ancona-Osimo|Archdiocese of Ancona-Osimo]] | district= | consecration_year= | status= [[Cathedral]] | leadership= | website= | architect= | architecture_type= [[Church (building)|Church]] | architecture_style= [[Romanesque architecture|Romanesque]] | specifications=no | facade_direction= | groundbreaking=996 | year_completed=1017 | construction_cost= | capacity= | length= | width= | width_nave= | height_max= | materials= }} [[File:Ancona S.Ciriaco (43).JPG|thumb|right|250px|Ancona Cathedral, facade]] '''Ancona Cathedral''' ({{lang-it|Duomo di Ancona}}, ''Basilica Cattedrale Metropolitana di San Ciriaco'') is a [[Roman Catholic]] [[cathedral]] in [[Ancona]], central [[Italy]], dedicated to Saint [[Cyriacus of Ancona]]. It is the seat of the [[Archbishop of Ancona]]. The building is an example of mixed [[Romanesque architecture|Romanesque]]-Byzantine and [[Gothic architecture in Italy|Gothic]] elements, and stands on the site of the former [[acropolis]] of the [[Greater Greece|Greek]] city, the Guasco hill which overlooks Ancona and its gulf. ==History== Excavations carried on in 2016 proved that an [[Italic tribes|Italic temple]], perhaps dedicated to [[Aphrodite (mythology)|Aphrodite]], existed on the site as early as the 3rd century BC. On top of it, in the 6th century CE, a Palaeo-Christian church was built: this had a nave and three aisles with the entrance facing south-east (where the current Chapel of the Crucifix is). Some remains of it still in existence include a mosaic pavement and perimeter walls. In 995–1015 a new church was built, which kept the original walls. In 1017 the renovated [[basilica]] received the [[relics]] of Saint [[Marcellinus of Ancona]] and Saint Cyriacus. Further enlargement works occurred between the late 12th and the early 13th centuries, with the addition of a transept to obtain a [[Greek cross]] plan, and an entrance towards the south-west, resulting in the church now facing the port and the new road entering the city. The transepts were at a higher level than the previous nave, and had apses. The church, previously dedicated to [[Saint Lawrence]], was re-dedicated to Saint Cyriacus the Martyr, the patron saint and (possibly) bishop of Ancona. [[File:Ancona San Ciriaco.jpg|left|thumb|One of the red marble lions in the portal]] An initial restoration took place in 1883. During [[World War I]], on 24 May 1915, the basilica was damaged by a bombardment of the [[Austro-Hungarian]] fleet. The damage was restored in 1920, but in [[World War II]] Anglo-American aerial bombings destroyed the south transept and the Crypt of Tears under it, along with the art treasures housed there. Once the transept was rebuilt, the church was officially reopened in 1951. Further damage was caused by an earthquake in 1972, followed by a new restoration and another official opening in 1977. In 1926 the cathedral was declared a [[basilica minor]]. ==Description== ===Exterior=== The edifice is built in white stone from [[Mount Conero]], with apses protruding from the transept's ends and an elevated body, with a dome at the crossing, in correspondence to the nave. All the external surfaces feature a decoration of [[Lombard band]]s. The bell tower is in an isolated position. It is mentioned from 1314 and was built above a pre-existing late 13th-century tower. [[File:Ancona, Duomo di San Ciriaco, X-XII secolo (13).JPG|thumb|250px|Interior view]] [[File:Ancona, Duomo di San Ciriaco, X-XII secolo (15).jpg|thumb|250px|The 1189 balustrade tiles]] The façade, divided into three section, is preceded by a wide staircase; above it is a 13th-century Romanesque portal formed by a round arch supported by four columns. The anterior ones stand on lions in Veronese red marble, while the rear ones, added later by [[Luigi Vanvitelli]], are on a simple pedestal. Under the arches are four reliefs depicting the symbols of the [[Four Evangelists|Evangelists]]. The portal is attributed to [[Giorgio da Como]] (c. 1228), and is in Romanesque-Gothic style, built in Conero white stone from [[Mount Conero]] and Veronese red marble. It is decorated by a series of columns holding ogival arches with reliefs of saints' busts, animal figures and vegetable motifs. Above the portal is a large [[oculus]] with a Romanesque frame between two single [[mullioned window]]s. The dome is one of the most ancient in Italy. It has an ogival shape with a dodecagonal drum, standing on a square base with small decorative arches. It was built over the crossing in the 13th century, and is attributed to [[Margaritone d'Arezzo]] (1270). Together with the church of [[Basilica di Sant'Antonio da Padova|Sant'Antonio]] at [[Padua]] and [[St. Mark's Basilica]] in [[Venice]], it was one of the few contemporary examples of domes built in churches, instead than in separate baptisteries. The copper cover was added in the 16th century. ===Interior=== The interior is on the [[Greek cross]] plan. All the arms are divided into a nave and two aisles, with re-used antique Roman columns with Byzantine capitals. At the crossing is the internal part of the dome, which has [[pendentive]]s with Byzantine-style figures of praying angels. The dome is supported by cruciform cluster piers. The side arms of the transept end in elevated apses, while the central arm of the [[Presbytery (architecture)|presbytery]] lost the original apse during the enlargement works of the 18th century. All the naves have hull-shaped, painted wooden vaults dating from the 15th century. At the beginning of the northern nave is the monument to a [[Fermo]] warrior from 1530. The south transept is home to the Chapel of the Crucifix. Its screens (''transennae'') are formed by tiles with [[sgraffito]] decoration from a balustrade of 1189. They depict, on the left, [[Jeremiah]] and [[Habakkuk]]; the Eternal Father and the Blessed Virgin; an angel and Saint [[John the Evangelist]]; and Saint Cyriacus; and, on the right, figures of animals: two [[Crane (bird)|crane]]s on a pomegranate tree, an eagle, two peacocks on a tree and two gryphons. In the Crypt of Tears below, rebuilt after the devastation of World War II, are remains of ancient structures. The presbytery's arms house, in the northern aisles, the sepulchre of Blessed [[Girolamo Ginelli]] (d. 1506), made in 1509 by [[Giovanni Dalmata]]. The northern transept houses the Madonna Chapel, with a lavishly decorated niche designed by [[Luigi Vanvitelli]] in 1739, which is the site of a venerated 17th century image of the Madonna. Under the chapel is a crypt with the remains of [[Judas Cyriacus|Saint Cyriacus of Ancona]] (in a marble case), Saints Liberius and Marcellinus (in Sicilian jasper) and the ashes of [[Saint Palatia]]. The urns with bronze festoons were designed and executed between 1757 and 1760 by [[Gioacchino Varlè]]. ===Photos=== File:S, Ciriaco AN vista ingresso.JPG|Main entrance File:AN S.Ciriaco ingresso..JPG|Main entrance File:Ancona S.Ciriaco leone.JPG|Lion to the left of the entrance File:S.Ciriaco leone.JPG|The same File:Ancona S.Ciriaco leoni.JPG|Both lions at the entrance File:Ancona S.Ciriaco ingresso laterale.JPG|Side entrance File:Ancona S.Ciriaco campanile.JPG|Campanile File:AN S. Ciriaco sinistra.JPG|Portico from the south File:AN Duomo posteriore.JPG|East end File:Scalone Nappi AN.JPG|The Nappi stairs File:Ancona S.Ciriaco museo diocesano.JPG|Museum entrance File:S. Ciriaco cortile museo.JPG|Museum courtyard {{commons category|San Ciriaco (Ancona)}} ==Sources== *{{cite book|first=M. Luisa |last=Polichetti|title=San Ciriaco. La Cattedrale di Ancona. Genesi e sviluppo|publisher=Federico Motta |year=2003|isbn=88-7179-353-6}} ==External links== *[http://www.medioevo.org/artemedievale/Pages/Marche/Ancona.html Page at Medioevo.org art website] {{it icon}} [[Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1017]] [[Category:11th-century Roman Catholic church buildings]] [[Category:Roman Catholic churches in Ancona]] [[Category:Romanesque architecture in le Marche]] [[Category:Gothic architecture in le Marche]] [[Category:Byzantine architecture]] [[Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Italy]] [[Category:Cathedrals in the Marche]] [[Category:Basilica churches in the Marche]] [[Category:Church buildings with domes]]
